intro: Erycibe micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and typically occur in clusters at the leaf axils. Erycibe micrantha is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
